Explanation: The bug in the buggy code is that it counts every pair of same adjacent numbers as a clump, while a clump is defined as a series of 2 or more adjacent elements of the same value. So, if there are more than 2 same adjacent numbers, it should be counted as one clump, not multiple. Generated Test cases 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 (6/11) should pass the buggy code, as they contain no or only pairs of same adjacent numbers. The other test cases contain more than 2 same adjacent numbers, which should be counted as one clump, but the buggy code counts them as multiple.
